event.title: led by José de Escandón in about 1749

data.event: Modern-day Hidalgo was first settled by Spanish colonists led by José de Escandón in about 1749.
In 1852, John Young settled in the area and renamed the town Edinburgh after his place of birth, Edinburgh, Scotland; Edinburgh became the county seat of Hidalgo County.
The town was incorporated in 1876, and its name was changed to Hidalgo in 1885.
